div.l: What wil ye do whiles it is in honde
By god right by the hopper wille I stonde
Quod Iohn and se hou the corn goth in
Yet saw I neuir by my fader kyn
How the hopper wagges to and fro
Aleyn aunswerd Iohn wilt thou so
Than wil I be byneth by my croun
And se hou the mele fallith doun
In to the trough shalbe my disporte
For Iohn in feyth I may be of your sorte
I am as euyl a myller as been ye
This myller smyled of their nycete
And thought alle this is done but for a wyle
They wene that noman may them begyle
But by my thrift yet shalle I blere their eye
For alle their slight and theire philosophy
The more queynt crakes that they make
The more shalle I stele whan I take
In stede of floure yet wil I gyue them bren
The gretest clerkes be nat the wisest men
As whilom to the wolf thus spake the mare
Of alle theire art ne count I nat a tare
Oute of the dore he goth fulle pryuely
Whan that he sawe his tyme softly
He lukith vp and doun tyl he hath founde
These clerkes horse where he stode y bounde
Behinde the mylle vndre a leef selle
And to the horse he goth faire and wel
He stripith of the brydel right anone
And whan the horse was loos he gan to gone
Toward the fenne where wilde marys renne
Forth with wehy through thicke and thynne
This myller goth ayen no worde he sayde
